title: HMS Precept (Z266)
text:
HMS "Precept" (Z266) was a <a href="net%20laying%20ship">net laying ship</a> for the <a href="Royal%20Navy">Royal Navy</a> during the <a href="Second%20World%20War">Second World War</a> acquired from the <a href="United%20States%20Navy">United States Navy</a> in October 1944 via <a href="Lend-Lease">Lend-Lease</a>. 
The ship was <a href="keel%20laying">laid down</a> as "Precept" (YN-79), a net tender of the , on 5 August 1943 at Barbour Boat Works in <a href="New%20Bern%2C%20North%20Carolina">New Bern, North Carolina</a>. On 17 January 1944, while still under construction, the ship was reclassified as a net laying ship and redesignated AN-73. "Precept" was <a href="launch%20%28ship%29">launch</a>ed on 11 April and completed on 13 October.
After delivery to the U.S. Navy on 14 October, she was transferred to the United Kingdom under Lend-Lease the same day and <a href="commission%20%28ship%29">commission</a>ed into the Royal Navy as HMS "Precept" (Z266). Upon completion of wartime duty with the United Kingdom, she arrived at <a href="Norfolk%2C%20Virginia">Norfolk, Virginia</a>, on 22 October 1945, and was returned to the U.S. Navy on 4 January 1946. Struck from the <a href="Naval%20Vessel%20Register">Naval Vessel Register</a> on 28 March 1946, she was transferred to the <a href="United%20States%20Maritime%20Commission">United States Maritime Commission</a> on 21 March 1947 and sold.
